alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 6:18PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...along the Little Susitna River. * WHEN...Until 500 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Water levels for the Little-Su at Houston are expected to rise in to minor flood stage Sunday morning. - Little additional rain is expected this evening, but rivers will continue to respond to rain in the last 24 hours. - For Little Susitna at Houston: At 4:00pm the stage was 6.25 feet. Flood Stage is 11.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 11.5 feet is expected Sunday afternoon - For Little Su below Hatcher Pass Bridge: At 5:15pm the stage was 6.75 feet. Flood Stage is 6.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 6.8 feet is expected late Saturday evening Impacts: At 9.2 feet: Bankfull levels for riverfront property in the Enchanted Forest subdivision just east of the Parks Hwy; south side of river At 9.5 feet: water levels slightly overbank at low lying riverfront property just east of the Parks Hwy In 2022, water levels exceeding minor flood stage resulted in flood impacts to several properties adjacent to the little susitna river. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
